name: Anthurium plowmannii
description: Anthurium plowmanii is an epiphytic aroid native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Peru and Ecuador. It belongs to the Araceae family and features large, lance-shaped to oval, dark green leaves (30-60 cm long) with prominent white or silver veins. The leaves have a distinctive wavy margin. The plant displays an upright, compact growth habit and typically reaches 60-120 cm in height. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers typical of aroids. In its native habitat, it grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks and branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds unique interest with its large, veined leaves. It's popular among aroid enthusiasts for its attractive foliage.
